quote:
Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
- Qur'an

Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear.
- Qur'an

Do not lose hope, nor be sad.
- Qur'an

Whoever relies upon Allah — then He is sufficient for him.
- Qur'an

The strong person is not the one who can wrestle others, but the one who controls himself when angry.
- Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

The most beloved deeds to Allah are those done regularly, even if small.
- Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

The best among you are those who bring the greatest benefit to others.
- Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

Charity does not decrease wealth.
- Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
- Islamic Proverb

The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
- Lao Tzu

Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
- Aristotle

Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
- Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
- Nelson Mandela

Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
- Dalai Lama

Do what is right, not what is easy.
- Unknown (ethical maximal)

We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
- Will Durant (summarizing Aristotle)
source: The Story of Philosophy (paraphrase of Aristotle)

quote:
Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
- William James

Well done is better than well said.
- Benjamin Franklin

Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
- Theodore Roosevelt

Believe you can and you're halfway there.
- Theodore Roosevelt

Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
- Arthur Ashe

The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
- Steve Jobs

The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
- Mahatma Gandhi

Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
- Martin Luther King Jr.

Courage is grace under pressure.
- Ernest Hemingway

Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
- Winston Churchill

It always seems impossible until it’s done.
- Nelson Mandela

What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
- Zig Ziglar

Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
- Mahatma Gandhi

You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
- Wayne Gretzky

Happiness depends upon ourselves.
- Aristotle

The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
- Franklin D. Roosevelt

Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
- Sam Levenson

The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
- Eleanor Roosevelt

Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
- Julie Andrews

You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
- Marcus Aurelius

Well begun is half done.
- Aristotle (traditional attribution)

The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand.
- Napoleon Hill

Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
- Peter Marshall

A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
- Nelson Mandela

Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
- Walt Whitman

Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
- Mark Twain

He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything.
- Proverb

If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
- African Proverb

To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
- Eleanor Roosevelt

Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
- Anonymous

The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
- Benjamin Franklin

What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
- Dr. Seuss
source: I Can Read With My Eyes Shut!

quote:
The mind is everything. What you think you become.
- Buddha

A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
- Winston Churchill

Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
- Seneca

You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
- Zig Ziglar

The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
- Chinese Proverb

Dream big and dare to fail.
- Norman Vaughan

Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
- Confucius

Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
- Voltaire

A good example is the best sermon.
- Benjamin Franklin

No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
- Aesop

Honesty is the best policy.
- Benjamin Franklin

Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
- Mother Teresa

We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
- Winston Churchill

Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
- Dalai Lama

The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
- Robert Byrne

Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
- Mahatma Gandhi

Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
- Roy T. Bennett

When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love.
- Marcus Aurelius

Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
- Henry David Thoreau

The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
- Plato

The simplest acts of kindness are by far more powerful than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
- Mahatma Gandhi

Every moment is a fresh beginning.
- T.S. Eliot

What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight—it's the size of the fight in the dog.
- Mark Twain

Keep going. Everything you need will come to you at the perfect time.
- Unknown

The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
- Mark Twain

If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
- Milton Berle

You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
- William Faulkner

The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
- Edmund Burke

Make each day your masterpiece.
- John Wooden

The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
- Oprah Winfrey

A goal without a plan is just a wish.
- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

The best bridge between despair and hope is a good night's sleep.
- E. Joseph Cossman

Work hard in silence, let success make the noise.
- Frank Ocean

To give anything less than your best is to sacrifice the gift.
- Steve Prefontaine

The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
- Vince Lombardi

The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
- Walt Disney

There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
- Beverly Sills

If you want light to come into your life, stand where it is shining.
- Guy Finley

When one door of happiness closes, another opens.
- Helen Keller

It is never too late to be what you might have been.
- George Eliot

Don't count the days, make the days count.
- Muhammad Ali

To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
- Winston Churchill

I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
- Stephen Covey
source: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

quote:
The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.
- Unknown

We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
- Mother Teresa

Either you run the day or the day runs you.
- Jim Rohn

If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
- Napoleon Hill

Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.
- Matt Cameron

The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
- Alan Kay

It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.
- Vince Lombardi

Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
- Theodore Roosevelt

Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
- Charles R. Swindoll

We become what we think about.
- Earl Nightingale

The only journey is the one within.
- Rainer Maria Rilke

Nothing will work unless you do.
- Maya Angelou

The secret to getting ahead is getting started.
- Agatha Christie (often misattributed to Twain)

To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
- Eleanor Roosevelt

Better to light a candle than curse the darkness.
- Eleanor Roosevelt (paraphrase of proverb)

Be not afraid of going slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
- Chinese Proverb

A little progress each day adds up to big results.
- Satya Nani (popularized phrasing)

The more I know, the more I realize I know nothing.
- Socrates

Don't wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
- Jim Rohn

The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually fearing you will make one.
- Elbert Hubbard

If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
- Anonymous

You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
- C.S. Lewis

What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
- Plutarch

Tough times never last but tough people do.
- Robert H. Schuller

Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
- Albert Einstein

Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
- Suzy Kassem

Don't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
- Anonymous

The only way to have a friend is to be one.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
- Unknown

You do not find the happy life. You make it.
- Camilla Eyring Kimball

Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
- Joshua J. Marine

To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
- Oscar Wilde
source: The Soul of Man under Socialism

quote:
Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
- Desmond Tutu

The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
- William James

We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
- Maya Angelou

Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
- Jim Ryun

Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.
- Albert Einstein

A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
- Joseph Campbell

What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
- Jane Goodall

One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world.
- Malala Yousafzai

I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
- Thomas Edison

The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
- George Washington

Begin anywhere.
- John Cage

Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
- Robert F. Kennedy

The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
- Nelson Mandela

Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
- Maya Angelou

Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity.
- Roy T. Bennett

Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
- Unknown

Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
- Martin Luther King Jr.

Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
- James Baldwin

A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
- George S. Patton

If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
- Booker T. Washington

The more you give, the more comes back. That's the law.
- Wayne Dyer

Life is about making an impact, not making an income.
- Kevin Kruse

A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
- John A. Shedd

Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
- Langston Hughes

Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
- Robert Louis Stevenson

- Henry J. Kaiser

Make your life a mission — not an intermission.
- Arnold Glasgow

Skill to do comes of doing.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
- Mahatma Gandhi

The true test of character is how you treat the poor, the powerless, the vulnerable.
- Unknown

To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
- Audrey Hepburn

- Unknown (inspirational maxim)

Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
- Steve Maraboli

If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you have to do is wake up.
- J.M. Power

The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
- Anonymous

The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
- Mark Twain

The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.
- John Ruskin

True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
- Paul Sweeney

The beautiful thing about learning is nobody can take it away from you.
- B.B. King

The more that you give away, the more you get back.
- Unknown (philosophical maxim)

You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
- Rabindranath Tagore

Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
- Zig Ziglar

If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.
- Dolly Parton

The more I practice, the luckier I get.
- Gary Player

If you want others to be happy, practice compassion.
- Dalai Lama

Do not underestimate the power of small consistent actions.
- Unknown

- Dalai Lama

Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
- Newt Gingrich

Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
- Benjamin Spock

Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
- Henry David Thoreau

Let your faith be bigger than your fear.
- Unknown (spiritual maxim)

You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
- Rumi

Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift — that's why we call it the present.
- Eleanor Roosevelt

Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
- Babe Ruth

The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
- Winston Churchill

The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
- Marcus Aurelius

One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
- Bob Marley

The more light you allow within you, the brighter the world you live in will be.
- Shakti Gawain

The way to right wrongs is to turn the light of truth upon them.
- Ida B. Wells

The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
- Henry Ford

The best way out is always through.
- Robert Frost

Kindness begins with the understanding that we all struggle.
- Charles Glassman

- Wade Boggs

- Socrates

You can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
- Ronald Reagan

You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
- A.A. Milne

- Steve Maraboli

The only person who can pull me down is myself, and I'm not going to let myself pull me down anymore.
- C. JoyBell C.

- Unknown

Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
- Jim Rohn

There is no greater disability in society than the inability to see a person as more.
- Robert M. Hensel

We rise by lifting others.
- Robert Ingersoll

A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
- Jim Morrison

If you are going through hell, keep going.
- Winston Churchill

Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
- Pablo Picasso

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
- Eleanor Roosevelt

Try to be a little kinder than is necessary.
- J.M. Barrie

A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.
- Tim Cahill

What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
- Ralph Marston

- Roy T. Bennett

- C.S. Lewis

The dreamers are the saviors of the world.

- Maya Angelou

- Helen Keller

You must be the change you wish to see in the world.

Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for a kindness.
- Seneca

The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
- Mahatma Gandhi

How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
- Anne Frank

An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

- Ralph Waldo Emerson

The secret to getting things done is to act!

Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
- Jim Rohn

The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
- Charles Kingsleigh (fictional paraphrase)

Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.
- Henry David Thoreau

The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
- Audrey Hepburn

- Emanuel Swedenborg

Only by giving are you able to receive more than you already have.
- Jim Rohn

- Albert Pine

The highest result of education is tolerance.
- Helen Keller

Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
- Victor Hugo

You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.

Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
- John Wooden

- Benjamin Disraeli

You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.

Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.

When we do the best we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life.

Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.

- Mark Zuckerberg
